Your life will go much smoother if you just give up and accept that truth.
ko: 남들이 널 싫어할까 봐 무섭다지만, 정작 너도 싫어하는 사람이 있잖아? 산술적으로 따지면 네가 싫어하는 사람만큼 너를 싫어하는 사람도 똑같이 있게 마련이야. 네가 누군가를 싫어하지 않는다고 해서 남들도 널 싫어하지 않게 된다는 소리가 아니라, 네가 누군가를 싫어하면 누군가도 널 싫어한다는 사실은 바꿀 수 없다는 거야. 그냥 포기하고 그 사실을 받아들이면 인생이 훨씬 편해질 거야.

ko: 귀족 제도가 있다고 해서 귀족이 존재하는 건 아니야. 제도가 없더라도 타고난 자질로 금세 귀족이 되는 사람들이 있거든. 우리 같은 귀족은 뭐, 그냥 평민이나 다름없지.

ko: 파리에 있을 때 화가 두세 명이랑 알게 돼서 가끔 그 사람들 화실에 놀러 가곤 했어. 난 항상 그들의 작업 방식이랑 삶의 방식에 매료됐었거든.

ko: 한번은 밤늦게 막 알게 된 화가 화실에 갔는데, 다락방에 있는 어두운 방이었어.

ko: 수십 명의 남녀 학생들이 단상 위에 서 있는 실오라기 하나 걸치지 않은 남자 모델 한 명을 그리고 있었어.

en: Dozens of male and female students were drawing a lone, completely nude male model standing on a platform.
ko: 수십 명의 남녀 학생들이 단상 위에 선 알몸의 남자 모델 한 명을 그리고 있었어.

en: What kind of sweets did I like as a child? Even if I try to remember, I can't.

ko: 어릴 때 어떤 과자를 좋아했었는지 기억이 안 나.

ko: 17살이나 18살 때쯤부터 내 돈으로 과자를 사 먹기 시작했는데 항상 마시멜로를 샀어.

en: Of the sweets that I tasted in France, the ones that I'd like to eat most are the brioche, the baba au rhum and the marrons glacés.
ko: 프랑스에서 먹어본 과자들 중에서 제일 다시 먹고 싶은 건 브리오슈랑 바바 오 럼, 그리고 마롱 글라세야.

en: The brioche is like the bastard child of sponge cake and bread, but its taste is peerless.
ko: 브리오슈는 스펀지 케이크랑 빵 사이에서 태어난 아이 같은데 맛은 비길 데가 없어.

en: The brioche is like the bastard child of sponge cake and bread, but its feeling under the tongue is the best under the heavens.
ko: 브리오슈는 스펀지 케이크랑 빵을 섞어 놓은 것 같은데 혀에 닿는 느낌은 천하제일이야.

en: A marron glacé is a sugar coated chestnut, similar to the Japanese sweet natto.
ko: 마롱 글라세는 설탕을 입힌 밤인데 일본 과자인 나토랑 비슷해.

en: By the way, the pastry known as "Shu Cream" in Japan is not known under this name neither in England nor in France. If you ask for a "Shu Cream" in England, you will end up comically receiving shoe shine.
ko: 근데 일본에서 '슈크림'이라고 부르는 빵은 영국이나 프랑스에서는 그 이름으로 안 통해. 영국에서 '슈크림' 달라고 하면 웃기게도 구두약을 받게 될 거야.

en: Recently my brother in law, artillery major Y, came back from a three year trip in Paris. Surrounded by a great number of souvenirs he had brought back, we heard tales of his travels.
ko: 최근에 매형인 포병 소령 Y씨가 3년간의 파리 여행을 마치고 돌아왔어. 매형이 가져온 수많은 기념품에 둘러싸여서 여행 이야기를 들었지.

ko: 건축 같은 건... 별로 신경 안 써. 그냥 편안한 서재랑 아늑한 침실만 있으면 돼.

en: Friendship in itself is something very vague and even in cases of same-sex friendships, it takes many shapes and is brought on by many different motives.
ko: 우정이라는 것 자체가 워낙 모호해서 동성 친구 사이라도 형태가 제각각이고 동기도 아주 다양해.

en: As a rule, not only in humans, but also in animals, "sexual display" occurs, consciously or unconsciously, towards individuals of the opposite sex.
ko: 보통 사람뿐만 아니라 동물들도 의식적이든 무의식적이든 이성을 향해 '성적 과시'를 해.

en: Suppressing one's romantic feelings is not the same as having no such feelings.
ko: 연애 감정을 억누르는 게 감정이 아예 없는 거랑은 다르잖아.

en: This author doesn't understand at all what need would a man and a woman who can't be involved in a romantic relationship have of becoming friends.
ko: 이 작가는 연애를 할 수 없는 남녀가 굳이 친구가 될 필요가 있는지 전혀 이해를 못 하네.

en: This author doesn't understand at all why a man and a woman who can't become lovers would become friends.
ko: 이 작가는 왜 연인이 될 수 없는 남녀가 친구가 되는 건지 전혀 이해를 못 해.

en: He's a modern boy.
She's a modern girl.
I liked walking alone on the deserted beach in the evening.
ko: 저녁에 아무도 없는 해변을 혼자 걷는 게 좋았어.

en: Everytime her husband looked at me, he almost asked me: "For what purpose have you come here?"
ko: 그 여자 남편이 나를 볼 때마다 "여기 무슨 일로 왔어?"라고 물어볼 것만 같았어.

en: On a certain monday afternoon, a single horse carriage stopped in front of the hotel where I was staying.
ko: 어느 월요일 오후에 내가 묵던 호텔 앞에 마차 한 대가 멈춰 섰어.

en: The person who descended from the coach was a woman of about 22 or 23 with, if I had to say, a plain appearance. At a glance, I knew that she was a guest coming from Paris. She was alone.
ko: 마차에서 내린 사람은 스물둘이나 스물셋쯤 되어 보이는, 굳이 말하자면 평범한 외모의 여자였어. 한눈에 파리에서 온 손님이라는 걸 알 수 있었지. 혼자였어.

en: I asked her for her address.
Three days passed, four days passed. The wind blew once, it rained twice.
ko: 3일이 지나고 4일이 지났어. 바람이 한 번 불었고 비가 두 번 왔어.

en: As was my habit, I was walking on the beach after the rain.
ko: 습관처럼 비가 그친 뒤에 해변을 걷고 있었어.

en: Right feels wrong and wrong feels right.
ko: 맞는 게 틀린 것 같고 틀린 게 맞는 것 같아.

en: As was unusual for me, I got tired quickly and I sat down on the edge of a rock.
ko: 웬일인지 금방 지쳐서 바위 끝에 걸터앉았어.

en: Suddenly, I raised my ears to the faint sound of footsteps coming from behind me.
ko: 갑자기 뒤에서 들리는 희미한 발소리에 귀를 쫑긋 세웠어.

en: That was her. She was trying to creep up on me unnoticed.
ko: 그 여자였어. 들키지 않게 몰래 다가오려던 참이었지.

en: That was her. She was trying to sneak up on me silently.
ko: 그 여자였어. 소리 없이 살금살금 다가오고 있었어.

en: Her husband was supposed to come visit her from Paris for a single night Saturday night.
ko: 토요일 밤에 남편이 하룻밤 자고 가려고 파리에서 오기로 했었대.

en: In Paris and elsewhere, in the summer, husbands send their wives and children somewhere to escape the heat and they customarily leave to visit them on Saturday evening until Sunday.
ko: 파리나 다른 곳에서도 여름엔 남편들이 아내랑 아이들을 피서지로 보내고, 보통 토요일 저녁부터 일요일까지 보러 가곤 해.

en: Her body was already in the water from the waist down.
ko: 그 여자의 몸은 이미 허리까지 물에 잠겨 있었어.

en: Soon, I could only see her neck floating above the waves.
ko: 곧 파도 위로 목만 내밀고 떠 있는 게 보였어.

en: I had not once thought about going into the sea since I came here, but at this moment, for some reason, I wanted to remove my clothes.
ko: 여기 온 뒤로 바다에 들어갈 생각은 한 번도 안 해봤는데, 그 순간 왠지 옷을 벗고 싶어졌어.

en: She rarely talked to anybody.
ko: 걔는 거의 아무하고도 말을 안 했어.

en: "Novels? I hate novels." Oh muse, forgive her blasphemy.
ko: "소설? 난 소설 진짜 싫어해." 아, 뮤즈여, 그녀의 독설을 용서해 줘.

en: I heard a voice saying "Help me!". I laughed.
ko: "살려줘!" 하는 소리를 들었어. 난 웃음이 났지.

en: I heard a voice cry "Help!". I was laughing.
ko: "도와줘!"라고 외치는 소리를 들었어. 난 웃고 있었어.

en: I unconsciously removed my shirt.
I jumped into the water as in a trance.
At last, I brought her exhausted body upon the beach.
ko: 마침내 지친 그녀를 해변으로 데리고 나왔어.

en: The next day, at suppertime, I was introduced to her husband.
ko: 다음 날 저녁 식사 시간에 그녀의 남편을 소개받았어.

en: For some reason, her husband seemed to dislike that she spoke of me. In truth, she talked too much about me.
ko: 왠지 그녀의 남편은 그녀가 내 얘기를 하는 걸 싫어하는 것 같았어. 사실 그녀는 내 얘기를 너무 많이 했거든.

en: The following morning she said close to my ears: "We're going back to Paris tonight. He says that there's no way that he'll leave me alone in such a sad place. That's how it is."
ko: 다음 날 아침 그녀가 내 귓가에 속삭였어. "우리 오늘 밤에 파리로 돌아가. 이런 슬픈 곳에 날 혼자 둘 리가 없대. 그렇게 됐어."

en: The couple took a horse carriage that evening.
ko: 그 부부는 그날 저녁 마차를 탔어.

en: I liked walking alone on the deserted beach.
ko: 아무도 없는 해변을 혼자 걷는 게 좋았어.

en: It's outrageous that you're riding a bicycle even though you're a woman. Women should stop trying to imitate men.
ko: 여자애가 자전거를 타다니 말도 안 돼. 여자는 남자 흉내 내는 걸 그만둬야 해.

en: Three soldiers who came back from the war are renting a house at the edge of a small town on the shore of the Inland Sea and live together.
ko: 전쟁에서 돌아온 병사 세 명이 내해 연안의 작은 마을 변두리에 집을 빌려 같이 살고 있어.

en: The three veterans lived together in a rented cottage on the outskirts of a small town on the edge of the inland sea.
ko: 세 명의 참전 용사가 내해 끝자락에 있는 작은 마을 외곽의 셋집에서 함께 살았어.

en: When I play peekaboo with my baby, he stops crying immediately.
ko: 우리 애기랑 까꿍 놀이를 하면 바로 울음을 그쳐.

en: Jim put the key into the lock.
I don't like beer that much.

In the end, "feminity" is something that a woman is naturally furnished with, there is no need to make any effort to show it, and it's a quality such that even if one were to make conscious efforts to hide it, it would lead to nothing.
ko: 결국 '여성스러움'이란 여자가 태어날 때부터 갖추고 있는 거라, 굳이 보여주려고 애쓸 필요도 없고, 설령 감추려고 애써봤자 소용없는 거야.

en: Old customs are gradually being destroyed.

I saw some English female soldiers in yesterday night's news reel. For some, you couldn't tell whether it was a man or a woman, but the majority were rather feminine, and it didn't feel that grotesque.
ko: 어제 저녁 뉴스 영상에서 영국 여군들을 봤어. 어떤 사람들은 남자인지 여자인지 구분이 안 가기도 했지만, 대부분은 꽤 여성스러웠고 그렇게 이상해 보이지 않았어.

en: Please forgive my impoliteness in sending you suddenly such a strange letter.
ko: 갑자기 이런 이상한 편지를 보내서 무례하게 군 걸 용서해 줘.

en: She, with such a sweet and pure figure, killed herself while cursing both of our names.
ko: 그렇게 사랑스럽고 순수했던 그녀가 우리 둘의 이름을 저주하며 자살했어.

en: Yuriko Himekusa committed suicide.
Yuriko Himekusa killed herself.
All of a sudden, the front door bell rang and the dark shadow of a lone man slipped in quietly.
ko: 갑자기 현관 벨이 울리더니 웬 남자의 검은 그림자가 조용히 들어왔어.

en: This year is two thousand eleven.
I have fifteen hundred cows.
I have one thousand and five hundred cows.
We live near the large library.
Was there an autopsy?
Is it OK to smoke around here?
It has been getting colder and colder, and I spend much more time in my futon.
ko: 점점 더 추워져서 이불 속에 있는 시간이 많아졌어.

en: I will email you after I check it thoroughly.
I do a lot in parallel, therefore I do not only read Akutagawa. At the moment, I am reading more and more in English. I am also reading a bit in German every day.
ko: 난 여러 가지를 동시에 하는 편이라 아쿠타가와만 읽는 게 아니야. 요즘은 영어로 된 책을 점점 더 많이 읽고 있고, 매일 독일어도 조금씩 읽어.

en: I do many things at the same time, so not only am I reading things by Akutagawa, I've also increased the amount of time I spend reading in English and I also read a little in German every day.
ko: 난 한꺼번에 많은 일을 하는 편이라 아쿠타가와 작품만 읽는 게 아니라, 영어 독서 시간도 늘렸고 매일 독일어도 조금씩 읽고 있어.

en: Have you finished reading the biography of Jobs?
Have you finished reading the book of Jobs?
You chicken out again, you coward?
My mom is two years younger than my dad.
ko: 우리 엄마는 아빠보다 두 살 연하야.

en: The only thing that I know for certain is that I exist.
ko: 내가 확실히 아는 단 한 가지는 내가 존재한다는 거야.

en: Have you forgotten about me?
He was killed by my hand.
The Titanic's maiden voyage didn't go so well.
ko: 타이타닉호의 처녀 항해는 그리 순탄치 않았어.

en: The night before we were to be married, she had an affair with my best friend.
ko: 우리 결혼식 전날 밤, 그녀는 내 절친이랑 바람을 피웠어.

en: It's a very bizarre animal.
Do you have a best friend?
There was some dew this morning.
The price of my dress' fabric is 10 Euros per meter.
Our school is further away than the station.
Her shyness makes me like her even more.
ko: 걔 수줍어하는 모습 때문에 더 좋아져.

en: What's the commotion?
The weather report said that there will be thunderstorms tomorrow evening.
ko: 일기예보에서 내일 저녁에 뇌우가 올 거래.

en: That's not it.
You shouldn't keep towels and cleaning rags together.
ko: 수건이랑 걸레를 같이 두면 안 돼.

en: He's in the kitchen.
It's time for us to leave.
I'm used to staying awake late into the night.
ko: 난 밤늦게까지 깨어 있는 게 익숙해.

en: Cats don't eat bananas.
Healing the wounds of the heart takes time.
ko: 마음의 상처가 아무는 데는 시간이 걸려.

en: I can see a woman and two dogs in the car.
ko: 차 안에 여자 한 명이랑 강아지 두 마리가 보여.

en: They must've had an accident.
Tom ate a crocodile.
He was innocent.
Dinner was awesome.
Emails have started suddenly disappearing from my inbox.
ko: 받은 편지함에서 이메일들이 갑자기 사라지기 시작했어.

en: I subscribed to a new email magazine.
I want to go to the moon.
I received an eReader for Christmas.
Do you have a ticket?
Do you have the tickets?
I'll show you around town.
When I take a deep breath, a pain runs down the right side of my back.
ko: 숨을 크게 들이마시면 등 오른쪽이 아파.

en: Chances are here, take them.
In a few seconds I would have overcome the desperation threshold.
ko: 몇 초만 더 있었으면 절망의 문턱을 넘었을 거야.

en: Do Martians speak English?
I've got a feeling that something is about to happen.
ko: 왠지 무슨 일이 일어날 것만 같아.

en: I've got a feeling that Tom won't graduate this year.
ko: 왠지 톰이 올해 졸업 못 할 것 같아.

en: I pawned my guitar to pay the rent.
Put down your weapons!
It's a great plan, innit.
I want to become a bisque doll maker.
Janet Jackson had a wardrobe malfunction.
ko: 자넷 잭슨이 의상 노출 사고를 겪었어.

en: What is the time?
I couldn't answer.
"You should write a novel or something." "Nah, I don't think so. I can't see myself coming up with anything good, anyways."
ko: "소설 같은 거라도 써 봐." "아니, 됐어. 어차피 좋은 게 나올 것 같지도 않아."

en: His book is oriented towards children, but here and there are words that he has never seen before. He doesn't know whether it is just him, or if they are just simply difficult words, but he finds them not worth the effort to look up in a dictionary, so he just keeps on reading.
ko: 그 책은 아이들용이지만 여기저기 생전 처음 보는 단어들이 있어. 본인만 모르는 건지 그냥 어려운 단어인 건지는 모르겠지만, 사전까지 찾아볼 정도는 아닌 것 같아서 그냥 계속 읽어.

en: My friend from university gave me a Kindle because he said he wasn't using it anymore. It's the DX model with a large screen. It's not easy to use, but the screen is indeed quite nice. It hadn't bothered me until now, but it's become hard for me to read something on a normal LCD screen.
ko: 대학교 친구가 이제 안 쓴다면서 킨들을 줬어. 화면이 큰 DX 모델이야. 쓰기 편하지는 않은데 화면은 진짜 좋아. 전에는 신경 안 썼는데 이제는 일반 LCD 화면으로 뭘 읽는 게 힘들어졌어.

en: You must not be a virgin, right?
You're not an innocent girl, are you?
I'm a human being.
His father is an impostor.
Tom's constant arguing irritates some of his classmates. However, most of the class has just learned to ignore him.
ko: 톰이 계속 시비 거는 것 때문에 몇몇 반 친구들이 짜증 내. 하지만 대부분은 그냥 걔를 무시하는 법을 터득했어.

en: The economy is good.
I'm no liar.
Cut me some slack.
Be careful!
Please put away this box for me.
Quit gambling.
It's like he has this special skill of hitting pressure points.
ko: 걔는 무슨 급소 찌르는 특수 기술이라도 있는 것 같아.

en: If that's true, then she's better than me.
She overslept.
If you need an umbrella, I can lend you one.
The girl hired by the shop to attract customers is quite cute and every time I go there I end up buying a lot of things.
ko: 그 가게에서 손님 끌려고 고용한 여자애가 꽤 귀여워서 갈 때마다 이것저것 잔뜩 사게 돼.

en: That's something that happens quite often.
You can't trust computer translation.
How does that sound?
We're on the way home.
How about some coffee?
She lost a book.
Will he recover?
He is a gentleman among gentlemen.
I have already finished reading this book.
ko: 나 이 책 벌써 다 읽었어.

en: I've already finished reading this book.
ko: 나 이미 이 책 다 읽었어.

en: A cat has two ears.
There aren't any problems.
We'll decide it like men, bring the dice!
We'll need twenty dice to play this game.
ko: 이 게임 하려면 주사위 20개는 있어야 돼.

en: Don't get steamed up.
Whether we win or lose, I won't have any hard feelings.
Papa, let's have a face-to-face laugh battle!
ko: 아빠, 우리 마주 보고 웃기 내기 하자!

en: Daddy, let's see if you can out-stare me.
Daddy, let's have a staring contest.
Daddy, let's make faces at each other and see who can keep from laughing the longest.
ko: 아빠, 서로 웃긴 표정 지어서 누가 더 오래 안 웃나 내기 하자.

en: I stared at papers all day today and now I'm tired.
ko: 하루 종일 서류만 들여다봤더니 피곤해 죽겠어.

en: The patient got over the critical stage.
My parents had an arranged marriage.
I'm hating this weather!
He has a white cat.
The meeting ended.
In Japan, radioactive cesium was detected in baby formula.
A leak has been found at Tokyo Electricity's Fukishima reactor number 1, and 150 liters of waters have escaped into the sea.
ko: 도쿄전력 후쿠시마 원전 1호기에서 누출이 발견돼서 바다로 물 150리터가 흘러 들어갔대.

en: If you pass this test, you could graduate next month.
ko: 이번 시험 통과하면 다음 달에 졸업할 수 있어.

en: Me and him are friends.
I want you to kiss me.
My three-year-old niece kissed me on the cheek.
ko: 세 살짜리 조카가 내 볼에 뽀뽀해 줬어.

en: She's a precocious one eh?
She was the first girl I'd ever kissed.
What time do you think he'll come back?
ko: 걔가 몇 시쯤 돌아올 것 같아?

en: What time do you think he'll be back?
ko: 걔가 몇 시쯤 올 것 같아?

en: Is it raining?
Why do the five yen coin and the fifty yen coin have holes in the center?
ko: 왜 5엔짜리랑 50엔짜리 동전은 가운데에 구멍이 뚫려 있어?

en: I have a sore throat. Do you have a cough drop?
The natural sweet-fish broiled with salt is absolutely terrific.

It is true that Aristotle distinguishes the tyrant from the king by the fact that the former governs in his own interest, and the latter only for the good of his subjects; but it would follow from Aristotle's distinction that, from the very beginning of the world, there has not yet been a single king.
ko: 아리스토텔레스가 폭군은 자기 이익을 위해, 왕은 백성을 위해 통치한다고 구분한 건 맞는데, 그 기준대로라면 세상에 왕다운 왕은 단 한 명도 없었던 셈이지.

en: The pleasure of possessing is not in my estimation worth the trouble of acquiring.
ko: 가지는 기쁨이 그걸 얻으려고 고생하는 것만큼의 가치는 없는 것 같아.

en: You left us, mate.
Why do you ignore me?
Excuse me, I'd like a double scoop of mint chocolate chip and orange sherbet in a regular-size cone please.
ko: 저기요, 민트초코랑 오렌지 샤베트 더블 주시고요, 보통 사이즈 콘으로 주세요.

en: Ready, rock-paper-scissors! It's a draw!
She bought a new car.
Making a living as a manga artist is almost impossible.
Have you read "Structure and Power - Beyond Semiotics" by Akira Asada?
ko: 아사다 아키라의 '구조와 힘: 기호학을 넘어서' 읽어봤어?

en: I lost my grandfather to cancer this year.
My grandfather succumbed to a terminal cancer this year.
Don't wait.
Is that from a book?
Jiro Akagawa has written over 480 novels.
Face facts!
Oh no!
Did you see yesterday's total lunar eclipse?
I got a new girlfriend; you didn't know?
Her insistence was right. She did not need to feel ashamed.
ko: 걔 말이 맞았어. 부끄러워할 필요 없었어.

en: As is often the case with educated people, he likes classical music better than popular music.
ko: 배운 사람들이 흔히 그렇듯이, 그 사람도 대중음악보다 클래식을 더 좋아해.

en: I was at home.
